messages.message: Hi - does someone know the source of `fakelogs-*` indices on dogfood elasticsearch cluster? These are currently creating a new index and corresponding shards in the cluster on a daily basis, and will like to know what these might be for.

these look to be coming from following deployment, will be deleting them as they are resulting in high number of indices on the ES cluster-
```sudeep@Sudeeps-MacBook-Pro webapp % kubectl  -n instabase-dogfood get deploy | grep -i fake
fakelogs                                1/1     1            1           298d
sudeep@Sudeeps-MacBook-Pro webapp % kubectl -n instabase-dogfood get pods | grep -i fake
fakelogs-7cd9bfd8f5-mgmzd                               3/3     Running   0          32h```

this may have been created to test elasticsearch infra back in the day

@Aaron Tami do you have any idea about fakelogs?
Hmm doesnâ€™t ring a bell... probably safe to delete them
okay thanks for confirming! have deleted the deployment, and also removing the indices from ES
